articles.title: Order of Kim Jong Il Instituted
articles.content:
Order of Kim Jong Il Instituted
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Jong Il has been instituted in the DPRK on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Friday released a decree on instituting the order. 
					
					 This institution is to give state commendation to officials, service personnel, working people, military units, organs, enterprises and social and cooperative organizations who have made distinguished service in the drive to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Order of Kim Jong Il, as well as Order of Kim Il Sung, is the highest order in the country.
					
					 The order is 67mm in length and 65mm in width. Engraved on it is a portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il at the center of golden ear of rice above a shining golden five-point star. 
					
					 On its upper part is the emblem of the Workers' Party of Korea and on its lower part the national flag of the DPRK. On its back there are letters reading "Order of Kim Jong Il" and serial number and a pin. 
					
					 Its miniature medal has a five-point star at the center of golden plate 33mm in width and 10mm in length and a pin in the backside.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Prize Instituted
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Prize Instituted
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK instituted Kim Jong Il Prize on the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Friday promulgated a decree on it.
					
					 The prize will be conferred on officials and those that have made tangible contribution to the development of science, education, public health, literature and arts, media and sports through a vigorous drive to translate leader Kim Jong Il's noble desires into reality.
					
					 Kim Jong Il Prize is the top prize in the DPRK as well as Kim Il Sung Prize.
					
					 The gold medal of this prize has a shape of dodecagon 39 mm in diameter. It has shining golden rays symbolic of the Juche idea engraved and on its center there are a circle 24mm in inside diameter and 28mm in outer diameter and the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il in it.
					
					 Marked on the lower part of the circle are laurels symbolic of victory and glory and on its upper part are fruits, each 0.8 mm in diameter, symbolic of the successes achieved in building a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The medal is connected to a metal plate 27 mm in width and 11 mm in length by a gold ring and its total length is 65 mm.
					
					 On the backside of the medal are letters reading "Gold medal of   Kim Jong Il Prize" and there is a pin on the back of its metal plate.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize Instituted
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize Instituted
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK instituted Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Friday promulgated a decree in this regard. 
					
					 This state citation will be awarded to the youth league organizations and their officials and young people that set examples in the sacred struggle for further developing the youth movement led by Kim Jong Il to victory, defending the country and building a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					  Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize is the highest prize for the Korean youth along with Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize.
					
					 The medal of Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize has a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il engraved with golden color in relief in the golden color circle of 20 mm in diameter inside a red flag of 31 mm in length and 23 mm in width and there are below it 15 rays, Lake Chon on the top of Mt. Paektu and letters "Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize" on the blue band 20 mm in length and golden laurel trees on both sides.
					
					 The red flag bearing the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il symbolizes that the youth dynamically advance toward the struggle to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu symbolizes that the brilliant revolutionary tradition of the Workers' Party of Korea should be carried forward and developed.
					
					 The blue band inscribed with letters "Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize" and golden laurel trees symbolize the youth rallied as firm as a rock around Kim Jong Un and the firm resolution of the youth to take the lead in the work and life as befitting the soldiers of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Letters "The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly" are inscribed on the back side of the medal.
					
					 The medal having a metal plate inlaid with seven precious signs of the tri-color flag of the Republic 30 mm in width and 6 mm in length is connected with a link and has a pin on the back side of the metal plate.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Children Honour Prize Instituted
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Children Honour Prize Instituted
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK instituted Kim Jong Il Children Honour Prize on his 70th birth anniversary.
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK promulgated a decree on it Friday.
					
					 The institution of this prize is aimed at conveying to posterity the undying feats he performed for developing the children's union, his great loving care shown for its members and this state citation will be awarded to those who distinguished themselves in firmly preparing themselves as successors to the revolutionary cause of Songun, bearing deep in mind the august name and Kim Jong Il's smiling image.
					
					 This prize is the highest prize for the Korean children along with Kim Il Sung Children Honour Prize. 
					
					The badge of Kim Jong Il Children Honour Prize has a portrait of smiling Marshal Kim Jong Il engraved inside a golden circle 20mm in diameter in the center of a golden five-point star with golden rays 37mm in length and 37mm in width.
					
					 There are below it Lake Chon atop Mt. Paektu and letters "Kim Jong Il Children Honour Prize" on the national flag-shape band 20mm in length as well as a golden laurel trees on both sides of the star. 
					
					 The five-point star symbolizes the Korean Children's Union protecting the dear respected Kim Jong Un politically and ideologically with their lives and dynamically advancing for the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche despite any trials, armed with the great Juche idea, 
					
					 The Lake Chon is symbolic of the will to carry forward the revolutionary traditions of the Workers' Party of Korea through generations and the laurel trees represent the determination of the members of the union to advance, united close around Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The band symbolizes their resolution to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche and always prepare themselves for the socialist country true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Inscribed on the back of the badge are letters "Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK" and it has a pin.

articles.title: Projected US-S. Korea War Exercises Flayed
articles.content:
Projected US-S. Korea War Exercises Flayed
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued a statement on Saturday denouncing the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers for officially announcing their plan to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises from the end of February to late in April with more than 200 000 huge forces and huge quantities of latest war hardware involved.
					 The projected saber-rattling assumes more dangerous nature as it is set to take place after the U.S. made a shift in its military strategy to attaching importance to Asia and the Lee Myung Bak group is making desperate efforts to seek a way out of the crisis in the run-up to elections, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The U.S. and the Lee group is oft-repeating the stereotyped sophism that Key Resolve is to cope with "possible provocation" from someone and "annual exercises for defense" and the like, but no one would believe this claim. 
					
					 The reckless saber-rattling is no more than bluffing made by those who seek comfort, much upset by the daily growing might of Songun and unbreakable single-minded unity of the DPRK. 
					
					 It is, at the same time, a ridiculous trick to justify their policy for escalating the confrontation, pass the buck for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations to the north, divert elsewhere the south Korean people's criticism and public discontent and hold without difficulty the "National Assembly" election slated to take place in April by marshalling conservative forces.
					
					 The moves for a war against the north brought to light the fact that the "dialogue" and "flexibility" touted by them is no more than a lie.
					
					 All facts go to prove that the chieftain of escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula, the ringleader of deteriorated inter-Korean relations, and the prime mover of a war is none other than the U.S. and the puppet group and the Lee group is the shock-brigade and culprit of the aggressive war of the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Romanian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Romanian FM
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Cristian Diaconescu upon his appointment as foreign minister of Romania.
					 Expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop in mutual interests, the message wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Congratulatory Messages from Various Countries
articles.content:
Congratulatory Messages from Various Countries
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and people of the DPRK, received congratulatory messages and letters from different countries on his assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA). 
					 The messages and letters were from the chairman of the C.C., Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, the executive chairman of the PUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia, the general secretary of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, the general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, the president of the Socialist Party of Benin, the first secretary of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) and the president of the Workers' Party of Peru. 
					
					 They also came from the Syrian defense minister who is deputy commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces, the Vietnamese defense minister, the vice-chairman of the Workers' Party of Turkey, the chairman for National Defense, Security and International Relations of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the international secretary of the C.C., Brazilian Communist Party, the vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea who is secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council, the former defense minister of the Soviet Union, the executive director of the World Food Programme, the president of the International Fund for Agricultural Development, the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, the secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, the deputy director general of the African Regional Co
					
					 mmittee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the governor of Amur Region of Russia, the administrative governor of Maritime Territory of Russia, and other high-ranking officials of political, social, military and economic circles of China, Russia, Syria, Turkey, Jordan, Uzbekistan, Iran, Denmark, Germany, Sweden, France, Poland, UK, Ukraine, Italy, Spain, Nigeria, DR Congo, Uganda, Ethiopia, Brazil, Colombia, Peru and Ecuador, and representatives of international bodies, Juche idea study organizations, and organizations for supporting Korea's reunification and friendship with the DPRK. 
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Un's assumption of KPA supreme commandership is an expression of the Korean party, army and people's fixed will to carry to completion leader Kim Jong Il's cause of Songun revolution. 
					
					 They praised Kim Jong Un, another great person of Mt. Paektu, as peerlessly brilliant commander of Songun with indomitable will, guts and distinguished strategy and commanding art. 
					
					 They expressed belief that the service personnel and people of the DPRK would successfully accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation under his leadership true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK-Russia Agreements in Process of Implementation, Russia Says
articles.content:
DPRK-Russia Agreements in Process of Implementation, Russia Says
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The relations between Russia and the DPRK have been remarkably revitalized since the DPRK-Russia summits early in the 2000s, said Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E. Sukhinin at a press conference.
					 The meeting of Chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il with Russian President Dmitri Medvedev in Ulan-Ude of Russia in August 2011 injected fresh dynamism into the bilateral ties. 
					
					 At that meeting the two countries agreed to carry out interesting plans.
					
					 All these agreements are still valid and in the process of steady implementation.
					
					 The present leadership of the DPRK with Kim Jong Un as its supreme leader is abiding by all those agreements reached with Russia in the past. 
					
					 The construction of a gas pipe is no exception. 
					
					 The DPRK's leadership will continue adhering to the agreement on building the gas pipe on the Korean Peninsula in the future, too.
					
					  Gazprom of Russia keeps working with the DPRK's Ministry of Oil Industry over this issue.

articles.title: GFTUK Delegation Leaves for South Africa
articles.content:
GFTUK Delegation Leaves for South Africa
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea led by Choe Han Chun, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, departed here on Saturday by train to attend a meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions to be held in South Africa.

articles.title: New Posters Produced
articles.content:
New Posters Produced
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Posters have been produced in the DPRK to present to a national fine art festival for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					  Marked in posters are letters "National Fine Art Festival for Commemorating Centenary of Birth of Fatherly Leader" and the venue of the festival and its period.
					
					 Among them are a poster depicting the President's old home in Mangyongdae against the background of magnolia blossoms in full bloom, a poster portraying the Marshal's star on a red flag with letters reading "'The great sun of Songun Korea', National Fine Art Exhibition" and a poster with the letters reading "The 4th National Sketch Festival to Commemorate February 16" written on it.
					
					 Those posters represent the desire and wishes of the Korean people to hold Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem and significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Preparations for 16th Kimjongilia Festival Go Ahead
articles.content:
Preparations for 16th Kimjongilia Festival Go Ahead
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 16th Kimjongilia Festival are now under way in the DPRK. 
					 Ri Pyong Pha, a department director of the Korean Kimilsungia-Kimjongila Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 "The committee is paying much effort to holding the 16th Kimjongilia Festival most splendidly.
					
					 The festival will take place at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition in Pyongyang from mid-February, on the theme 'Our leader immortal along with Kimjongilia.'
					
					 The exhibition is being decorated well to host the festival. 
					
					 It will draw much more Kimjongilia flowers than before. Many of the exhibition stands will be conspicuous with portraits of Kim Jong Il with a broad smile on his face and pictures of the leader giving field guidance to economic sectors. 
					
					 The festival will be attended by military organs, ministries, national institutions, people of various social strata, schoolchildren and organizations of oversea Koreans, including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, as well as foreigners. 
					
					The number of applicants for the 16th festival is much higher than previous ones. 
					
					 This year's climatic situation is not suitable for cultivating flowers because of the lower percentage of sunshine than the average year. 
					
					 But many units in Pyongyang and local areas are cultivating Kimjongilia flowers in greenhouses with their utmost care." 
					
					 Festival posters have already been created.

articles.title: More Information Sources Added to Grand People's Study House
articles.content:
More Information Sources Added to Grand People's Study House
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Grand People's Study House in Pyongyang received more information sources. 
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent books and materials to the study house on four occasions in the wake of his presentation at the outset of this year.
					
					 1,460 books and materials of more than 1,360 kinds were conveyed to the house.
					
					 Among them were leader Kim Jong Il's work "Theory of Cinema Art" (Chinese version), book "Great Brilliant Commander Kim Jong Il" published by the Russian newspaper Patriot, "Menus of Korean Dishes on Moran Hill", "Family Library of Daily Cooking for Health" , "Noodle Dish," etc. helpful to the promotion of people's health and their diet.
					
					 They also include an illustrated world history book, a collection of humors, textbooks for learning foreign languages and other textbooks and dictionaries and materials which help the working people and school youth and children broaden their common knowledge and acquire a wealth of knowledge about foreign languages.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on History of Close Ties between Leader and People
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on History of Close Ties between Leader and People
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Korean people's reverence for leader Kim Jong Il is growing stronger as the days go by in the DPRK. This reality shows that no force can break the ties of kindred between the leader and the people.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's history of revolutionary activities was that of great harmonious whole between him and the army and people based on their closest ties, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The ties between him and the people of the DPRK were not technical relationship between a leader and his subordinates but were bonds between the father and his children based on one intention and affection and eternal comradely relations whereby to be in the same boat.
					
					 He said that his whole life is only for the people. This well shows his exceptional revolutionary career.
					
					 In the DPRK there has been no reserve between the party and the people as its leader personally would learn about wishes of the people and his people open their hearts to him in a familiar way. Leader Kim Jong Il's intention was just the will of the people and the people's wishes precisely meant his ideals.
					
					 The Korean people have held Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the sun of their life and their mental mainstay while making revolution under his guidance for many years.
					
					 In ten odd days of mourning over his demise when the whole country was in bitter grief a total of 260 million servicepersons and people expressed their condolences, crying in a choking voice "General, please wake up". Hundreds of thousands of people followed the car carrying his bier, wailing and shouting "You can't leave us".
					
					Such touching scenes vividly showed the true hearts of the Korean people whose relations with the leader would never be broken.
					
					 Today when the dear respected Kim Jong Un leads the Korean revolution in the van, the pure single-minded unity and solid ties of kindred in the DPRK remains still as it was when its army and people were united close around President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Reckless Remarks of Japanese Politicians under Fire
articles.content:
Reckless Remarks of Japanese Politicians under Fire
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Japanese prime minister and foreign minister recently talked rubbish about the DPRK, thus making profound confusion of right and wrong. They ballyhooed about "an unpredictable situation" and "halt to the uranium enrichment."
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Lurking behind these jargons is an ulterior intention to lead the DPRK to a "change."
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The world was admired at the loyalty, the sense of obligation, conviction of sure victory, will and spirit displayed by the service personnel and people of the DPRK during the period of mourning over the great loss to the nation.
					
					 Japan, too, must know that they who got united closer around the headquarters of the revolution by overcoming sorrow with strength and courage dynamically turned out as one in the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 The Japanese authorities should feel shame instead of hurling mud at the DPRK in the light of their dirty political landscape.
					
					 The "unpredictable situation" touted by them is something which can take place in such country as Japan.
					
					 There may be no time to spare for the Japanese politicians to mind other's business.
					
					 The Japanese authorities would be well advised to cope with such situation in their own country.

articles.title: KCNA Slashes War Exercises under Cloak of "Defense"
articles.content:
KCNA Slashes War Exercises under Cloak of "Defense"
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The United States is set to stage DPRK-targeted joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle together with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					 The war maneuvers to be kicked off allegedly calling for somebody's self-restraint in "provocations" are nothing but high-handed actions to justify its saber-rattling for aggression.
					
					 The projected reckless joint military maneuvers are aimed to establish the sphere of politico-military domination over the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 It is clear even to a mere child that the real aim of Key Resolve is not to cope with "a limited war to be provoked by someone" as it is to involve hundreds of thousands of U.S. troops, south Korean puppet forces and forces of satellite countries. It is also evident that Foal Eagle, too, is not exercises of defensive nature as it is three-dimensional drills for mobile and special operations in land, air and seas.
					
					 The projected joint war maneuvers will include joint landing operation between the U.S. and south Korean marine corps, the largest-ever in decades, to be staged across south Korea. This clearly proves the offensive nature of their saber-rattling.
					
					 No one can vouch that the above-said saber-rattling to be staged in the peninsula and waters around it would not lead to a new war.
					
					 When aggressors trumpet about "defense," they precisely mean a declaration of a war.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK are watching with vigilance the highly disturbing moves of aggressors in the peninsula and waters around it and, when a chance presents itself, they will never miss it but root out the very source of national misfortune and regional instability through a merciless punishment.

articles.title: Inclement Weather, Heavy Snow Hits S. Korea
articles.content:
Inclement Weather, Heavy Snow Hits S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The freezing cold and heavy snow hit various parts of south Korea, causing deaths and injuries, said south Korean KBS on Wednesday.
					 Icy roads caused traffic accidents in Kyonggi, North Jolla and Kangwon provinces of south Korea.
					
					 Airline and train services were canceled or delayed.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Protest against Anti-DPRK War Exercises
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Protest against Anti-DPRK War Exercises
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification issued a statement on Jan. 29 to denounce the south Korean puppet warmongers' projected war exercises.
					 The statement noted that the south Korean authorities have planned to stage Ssangryong joint military exercises, including infiltration drill, live firing drill and large-scale landing operation, in collusion with the United States in the area of Phohang in March.
					
					 Prior to it, they announced that they would kick off Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises in February, it said.
					
					 The exercises, to be launched under the OPLAN 5027, are the largest-ever in history and evidently war exercises for aggression on the DPRK, it pointed out.
					
					 What draws concerns is the fact that the Japanese "Self-Defence Forces" will take part in the exercises under the pretext of strengthening the military alliance, it said, adding that they may increase the military tension in the Korean Peninsula and, furthermore, lead to a nuclear war. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities go ahead with the military maneuvers despite the protest at home and abroad, they will face a stronger demand for their resignation, the statement warned, expressing the resolve to vigorously struggle against the joint military exercises.

articles.title: Newspaper of Overseas Koreans Blasts GNP's Red Herring
articles.content:
Newspaper of Overseas Koreans Blasts GNP's Red Herring
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Minjok Sibo, newspaper of overseas Koreans published in Japan, on Wednesday carried an article laying bare the truth about "the Grand National Party's" campaign kicked off to fool public in the run-up to the general election.
					 The article referred to the fact that driven into a predicament, the GNP is desperately staging a "revamping" farce.
					
					 The GNP failed in its policies mainly because it has pursued sycophancy towards the U.S. and a policy for escalating confrontation with the DPRK going against the trend of the era in which the nation aspires after peace, independence and reunification.
					
					 The GNP is fielding new persons as candidates for the "National Assembly" election but this is meaningless unless a fundamental change is made in its policies. Conservative ever since it came into being, the GNP can never change in its nature. No matter how often the GNP is gilded, it is bound to lose the shine sooner or later.
					
					 Park Geun-hye who became the chief of the Emergency Measure Committee of the GNP, too, is steeped in conservatism to the marrow of her bones.
					
					 It was none other than Park who described the May 16 coup which suppressed the people who called for democratization and reunification under jack boots as "a revolution" and strongly opposed the repeal of the "Security Law". And she backed those who pursued the policy of confrontation with the DPRK and railroaded the "motion calling for ratification of FTA" through the "National Assembly." In the final analysis, Park and Lee Myung Bak are of the same group.
					
					 One should not harbor any illusion about the GNP, warned the article.

articles.title: Koreans in US Accuses of S. Korean Ministry of Unification
articles.content:
Koreans in US Accuses of S. Korean Ministry of Unification
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. made public a statement on Feb. 2 accusing the south Korean Ministry of Unification of acting a parrot of the U.S.
					 The Policy Department of the DPRK National Defence Commission in an open questionnaire on the same day solemnly urged the south Korean authorities to look back themselves on whether they are entitled to be a dialogue partner, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 An official of the ministry, however, told that "there is no need to make answers to every question", hoping "the north would respond with sincerity to their efforts for resumption of dialogue."
					
					 Such remarks are quite astonishing and deplorable.
					
					 It is well-known to every member of the nation that the DPRK has so far made patient efforts for resumption of the north-south dialogue.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities are repeatedly talking nonsense as a parrot trained by the U.S.
					
					 The statement urged the Lee Myung Bak "government" to answer the DPRK's recent questionnaire with sincerity.
					
					 The Lee "government" should be mindful that the only way for improving the north-south relations is to stop such anti-national moves as the plan to stage with the U.S. the joint military exercises for preemptive attack on the DPRK, it said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Carried in Bulgarian Bulletin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Carried in Bulgarian Bulletin
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The BulgariaÔºçKorea Friendship Association carried the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il in bulletin No. 1.
					 The bulletin said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il authored lots of works during his Kim Il Sung University days not a few of which dealt with military affairs.
					
					 He formulated Songun politics as a main socialist political mode and led to victory the socialist cause in the DPRK and global independence against imperialism 
					
					 Making ceaseless field inspection of units of the Korean People's Army, he made sure that its politico-ideological and military and technical capability was bolstered in every way.
					
					 And he laid down the line of economic construction in the Songun era which calls for giving priority to the development of the defence industry.
					
					 The reality of the DPRK wining victory after victory under the banner of Songun greatly encourages the people of the countries aspiring after independence and giving strong impetus to the world socialist movement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Feats Praised by Italian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Feats Praised by Italian Figure
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Miriam Pelegrini Feri, chairman of the Italian Committee for the Study of Songun Idea for Independence and Sovereignty who doubles as president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy, issued a statement titled "Great elder statesman" on Jan. 28.
					 The statement said that leader Kim Jong Il developed the Workers' Party of Korea into an invincible united party and experienced and tested invincible party based on the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 In the whole course of leading the Korean people he won only victories without a single failure, setback and the slightest deviation and comprehensively systematized and developed in depth the Juche idea founded by the President, it noted, and went on:
					
					 He turned the DPRK into an invulnerable fortress which no formidable imperialist enemy dares attack, under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 His Songun politics not only helped put the DPRK on a status of a political, ideological and military power but made sure that a solid springboard was laid for building an economic power.
					
					 The undying feats he performed for the Korean revolution and global independence will always be remembered by mankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Personality and Spirit Introduced in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Personality and Spirit Introduced in Mexico
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism issued its bulletin No. 66 under the title "Son of Mt. Paektu" on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The bulletin edited a portrait of Kim Jong Il and articles under such titles as "Mt. Paektu recognizes its master." 
					
					 In an article titled "It seems to be blessing from sky" the bulletin dealt with the mysterious weather in the area of Mt. Paektu on February 16, 1942. Even the sky seemed to congratulate Kim Jong Il on his birth, it added.
					
					 In another article titled "42 and Mt. Paektu" the bulletin noted:
					
					 Mt. Paektu is situated at 42 degrees of North Latitude. 
					
					 It corresponds to the year 1942 when he was born. 
					
					 Mt. Paektu is associated with so many stories with profound meanings. 
					
					 He considered the steep mountains as a playground of his birthplace.
					
					 As people say a man is apt to resemble the area where he was born, Kim Jong Il resembled Mt. Paektu in the true sense of the word.
					
					 It attracts so many people for its majestic appearance as it has large lake Chon on its top and is surrounded by myriads of mountain peaks and mysterious natural wonders. 
					
					 They are a symbol of Kim Jong Il's personality and spirit featured by high aims, extraordinary wisdom, strong grit and will, unbounded magnanimity and perfect commanding ability.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Denmark, Austria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Denmark, Austria
						
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- A joint preparatory committee of Denmark for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Jan. 28 and an Austrian preparatory committee on Jan. 30.
					 Henning Yakobssen, member of the C.C., the Communist Party of Denmark, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected chairmen of the joint committee and Adolf Wurzer, general secretary of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The joint preparatory committee decided to send a congratulatory message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the Day of the Shinning Star and publish Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-victorious Banner of Our Revolution" in pamphlet.
					
					 The committees decided to hold various political and cultural events.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Commemorated in Various Countries
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Commemorated in Various Countries
						
Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il a meeting was held in France, lecture given in Guinea, a seminar on his feats and a book exhibition in Italy and a film show in Russia between Jan. 20 and 25.
					 On display in the venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos showing their undying feats and books and photos of the Korean people's socialist construction.
					
					 Participants of film shows watched "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and other Korean films. 
					
					 The president of the France-Korea Friendship Association said the great feats performed by Kim Jong Il for the Korean revolution and global independence would always be remembered by the world progressives. 
					
					 Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, said Kim Jong Il, regarding the idea of believing in people as in Heaven as his motto, devoted his whole life to the happiness of the people.
					
					 A secretary of the Milano City Committee of the Communist Party of Italy and a chief of the  teachers and students union of Milano said Kim Jong Il made a great distribution to friendship and solidarity among countries, the strengthening and development of the international labor movement and the progressives' anti-imperialist struggle and the struggle for building a new society.
					
					 Leontsiyev, general manager of the Stroimashintorg Company and Kiriyev, deputy general manager of the Maksimet Company of Russia, praised Kim Jong Il as an elder of the world revolution and universally recognized leader.

articles.title: True Colors of Human Rights Watch Exposed by Chinese Paper
articles.content:
True Colors of Human Rights Watch Exposed by Chinese Paper
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- People's Daily of China on January 26 released an article laying bare the true colors of Human Rights Watch, NGO-veiled plot-breeding organization of the U.S.
					 Pointing to the 2012 report worked out by it on human rights performance in more than 90 countries and regions, the paper said:
					
					 The body vehemently criticizes some countries while turning a blind eye to those countries beset with human rights abuses.
					
					 Just as the British Sunday Times put it, the organization only expects its report to be used by the U.S. administration. 
					
					 Human Rights Watch is a NGO, but one may comment it has something in common with the U.S. human rights diplomacy in its way of thinking.
					
					 The organization in its report again falsified the fact, bringing to light its despicable true colors as a body keen on interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
					
					 By doing so, Human Rights Watch allowed the trust in its ability to handle human rights issues and, at the same time, trust in itself to sink. 
					
					 Mark Galasco, an expert of the organization, had been active in Mid-east for several years under the pretext of investigating various war crimes. He had been in charge of confirming the air raid targets of the U.S. forces in Iraq.
					
					 At a press interview he admitted that he was involved in at least 50 air raids but there was not accurate targeting even once, killing hundreds of civilians only. On April 5, 2003 the coalition forces made an air strike at Basra of Iraq in an attempt to kill a man widely known as "chemist Ali" but it ended up killing 17 civilians only.
					
					 The above-said expert, a strong advocator of human rights, was a zealous collector of goods bearing German Nazi signs. He went the lengths of posting on Internet a photo of him dressed in shirt decorated with Nazi Order Cross. He is now working on a book about his grandfather who served in the German air force during the Second World War and busy getting it ready for printing.
					
					 An Israeli organization specializing in analyzing and assessing the composition of NGO, expressed skepticism about the report of the Human Rights Watch. The Israeli organization in a report released on Jan. 9 said: Human Rights Watch more often than not works out a report on the basis of unconfirmed and unreliable information. It is usually impossible to verify it as the HRW quoted "witnesses" as saying something on condition of anonymity. As for what it called "testifier" he is not the person visited by it itself but the one with whom it got in touch over Internet.
					
					 A fact requires reliable source of information and should be backed with coherent logic.
					
					 Any report unilateral and politically motivated disappoints people.
					
					 The report worked out by Human Rights Watch also helps us clearly understand the limited nature of this body and the ulterior political purpose pursued by it, in particular, on the basis of the new "Cold War-" minded way of thinking.

articles.title: Russia Rejects West's Sanctions on Iran
articles.content:
Russia Rejects West's Sanctions on Iran
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Vladimir Chizyov, Russian permanent representative to the European Union, denounced the West's sanctions on Iran at an interview with a news agency. 
					 Russia does not regard the sanctions as a correct way and critically approaches the West's sanctions on Iran, he said. 
					
					 Noting that the sanctions would strike at EU itself, he stressed that the West's sanctions on Iran would have no effect.

articles.title: Communication Center of Russian Aerospace Defense Force Set Up
articles.content:
Communication Center of Russian Aerospace Defense Force Set Up
						
 Moscow, February 3 (KCNA) -- Russia established a communication center for the Aerospace Defense Force.
					 An important task of the center is to ensure all kinds of communications to commanding posts of the units on combat duty.
					
					 The center will ensure about 2,800 phone calls and accept and transmit about 4,000 telegrams during 24 hours.
					
					 A spokesman for the Force said that communication systems of the Space Force and the Aerospace Defense Operation Strategic Headquarters were integrated within the framework of the newly organized Aerospace Defense Force.

articles.title: US Bleak Economic Prospect
articles.content:
US Bleak Economic Prospect
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Concerns about the bleak economic prospect of the country are growing stronger among Americans.
					 72 percent of respondents said that economic conditions will be worsened in the future, according to the recent survey released by gallup.

articles.title: American Airlines to Cut 13,000 Jobs
articles.content:
American Airlines to Cut 13,000 Jobs
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- U.S. carrier American Airlines said Wednesday that it wants to eliminate 13,000 jobs as it seeks to cut labor costs by 20 percent.

articles.title: Net Profits of Japanese Groups Fall
articles.content:
Net Profits of Japanese Groups Fall
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Japanese business groups' managing situation is getting worse due to the economic stagnation. 
					 Kansai Electric Power Co. said Tuesday it fell into the red in the April-December period with a group net loss of 118.11 billion yen. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Honda Motor Co. reported a group net profit of 139.89 billion yen, down 71.4 percent from the previous year, for the April-December period.
					
					 Mizuho Financial Group Inc. said it logged a group net profit of 270.96 billion yen in the same period of last year, down 35.8 percent from a year earlier.

articles.title: Japan's Vehicle Output in 2011 Falls 12.8%
articles.content:
Japan's Vehicle Output in 2011 Falls 12.8%
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Japan's vehicle production in 2011 fell 12.8 percent from the previous year, the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association said Tuesday.

articles.title: UN Concerns World's Shortage of Food, Water and Energy
articles.content:
UN Concerns World's Shortage of Food, Water and Energy
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The world is likely to face scarcities of food, water and energy, a UN report said on Monday.
					 The report anticipated the world population would stand at 9 billion by 2040.
					
					 If they are not provided with sufficient food, water and energy, about 3 billion of them will possibly be reduced to poverty.

articles.title: G77 Calls for Scaled-up Global Partnership to End Poverty
articles.content:
G77 Calls for Scaled-up Global Partnership to End Poverty
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Group of 77 on Wednesday made loud calls for a scaled-up global partnership to end poverty, particularly as the world surpasses one billion people living below poverty line.
					 "Despite some progress made in reducing poverty in some regions, we still have a long winding path to total eradication of poverty which poses itself as a most complex issue, with interplay of economic, political, social and historical factors," said Mourad Benmehidi, permanent representative of Algeria to the UN and chairman of G77.
					
					 With "current multiple, interrelated crises and challenges," such as the ongoing financial and economic crisis, the food crisis, and food insecurity and climate change, the situation has been exacerbated, he said.

articles.title: Cuba Improves Railroad Services
articles.content:
Cuba Improves Railroad Services
 Havana, February 3 (KCNA) -- Cuba exerted great efforts to improving railroad services.
					 In 2011, construction brigades rebuilt about 40 kilometers of railroad tracks, repaired 350 kilometers and gave maintenance to 6,000 kilometers.
					
					 Freight traffic by railway remarkably increased.

articles.title: Iran on Its Peaceful Use of Nuclear Technology
articles.content:
Iran on Its Peaceful Use of Nuclear Technology
 Tehran, February 3 (KCNA) -- Deputy Head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organization Naser Rastkhah said on Tuesday that Iran has always been transparent in its nuclear program.
					 In an interview with IRNA, he said that after the Kyodo meeting on reduction of greenhouse gasses in the world, most countries showed inclination to stop using fossil fuel and make use of nuclear energy instead. 
					
					 He added Iran enjoys a 30-year experience in the field of atomic energy and therefore it is natural for it to share its expertise and knowledge with those needing such an expertise.

articles.title: Pakistan Terms Drone Strikes Unlawful: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
Pakistan Terms Drone Strikes Unlawful: FM Spokesman
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Spokesperson of Pakistani foreign office Abdul Basit said Tuesday that the drone attacks in country's northwest tribal belt are unlawful and counterproductive, so they are unacceptable for Pakistan, local media reported.
					 According to a report by local TV channel Dunya, the spokesman in a statement said that Pakistan's position and point of view on the issue of U.S. drone strikes are clear and it believes that such attacks are in violation of the sovereignty of the country.

articles.title: Algeria Refuses to Provide Logistic Support to Western States
articles.content:
Algeria Refuses to Provide Logistic Support to Western States
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Algeria has refused to provide logistic support to French and British special forces ahead of their military operations against Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM), local El Khabar newspaper reported Saturday.
					 Algeria has rejected a French request to use Algerian territory for the landing of aircrafts and helicopters of special forces to track down senior militants of AQIM, the newspaper quoted a source close to the case as saying.
					
					 The source said that the military operations against AQIM do not aim only at releasing Westerner hostages abducted by it, but also at conducting liquidation operations against senior officials of the terrorist group.

articles.title: Palestine Rejects Expansion of 70 West Bank Settlement by Israel
articles.content:
Palestine Rejects Expansion of 70 West Bank Settlement by Israel
						
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- A Palestinian official on Tuesday accused Israel of spoiling the international vision of the two-state solution based on 1967 borders, by expanding 70 Jewish settlements in the West Bank.
					 Mohamed Ghuneim, Palestinian minister for Israeli settlement affairs, said in an exclusive interview with Xinhua that Israel has recently "unprecedentedly escalated the settlement activities on the territories it is still seizing in the West Bank and east Jerusalem, adding that "this aims at changing realities on the ground by the expansion of settlements."

articles.title: Cooperation among Developing Nations
articles.content:
Cooperation among Developing Nations
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Ethiopia and Gambia have signed on Tuesday agreements on trade and investment and a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on co-operation in education, health and social sectors.
					 Brazil's trade with Middle East and North African countries increased 28.6 percent in 2011.

articles.title: Italy's Unemployment Rate Hits Record High Since 2004
articles.content:
Italy's Unemployment Rate Hits Record High Since 2004
 Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Italy's unemployment rate reached 8.9 percent in December 2011, a record-high level since 2004, the national statistics agency Istat said on Tuesday.
					 According to the Istat, 2.24 million Italians did not have a job at the end of last year.

articles.title: CRPP condena inminentes ejercicios militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP condena inminentes ejercicios militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de febrero (ACNC) -- En una declaracion publicada este sabado, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) condeno a EE.UU. y los belicistas titeres surcoreanos que anunciaron oficialmente que librarian desde finales de febrero hasta finales de abril los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle"  con la participacion de mas de 200 mil efectivos y numerosos equipos belicos ultramodernos.
					 "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" resultan mas peligrosos porque se realizaran cuando la estrategia militar de EE.UU. fue enmendada en direccion de dar importancia a Asia y la banda de Lee esta desesperada para buscar la salida de su crisis en las proximas elecciones, senala el texto y continua:
					
					 Nadie creera el repetido chisme de EE.UU. y la camarilla de Lee Myung Bak de que "Key Resolve" es para hacer frente a la "posible provocacion" de alguien y se trata de "un entrenamiento anual de defensa".
					
					Los aventureros ejercicios militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea no son mas que una fanfarroneria de los que tienen miedo al creciente poderio del Songun y la inquebrantable unidad monolitica de la RPDC.
					
					  Igualmente, devienen una artimana ridicula de los titeres surcoreanos para justificar su politica de enfrentamiento, imputar la responsabilidad por la ruptura de relaciones intercoreanas, aplacar el descontento de la opinion publica y realizar sin problemas las elecciones de "asambleistas" de abril venidero aglutinando a las fuerzas conservadoras.
					
					  Ademas, revelan a todo el mundo el caracter fraudulento del "dialogo", "flexibilidad" y otras palabras por el estilo de ellos.
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran que EE.UU. y sus satelites surcoreanos son los culpables verdaderos de la exacerbacion de tensiones en la Peninsula Coreana y la ruptura de relaciones N-S, y los provocadores de guerra y que los compinches de Lee son lacayos que ejecutan al frente las guerras de agresion de EE.UU..

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre filial de biotecnologia
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre filial de biotecnologia
Pyongyang, 4 de febrero (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim recorrio el dia  3  la filial de biotecnologia de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Gracias a la minuciosa direccion y atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il la filial doto con suficiencia de las instalaciones para la investigacion de ciencias de punta y fue acondicionado el invernadero moderno para la investigacion cientifica y la produccion de patrones de manzanos bajos.
					
					En acato alto al legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, los cientificos y los investigadores de este filial  abrieron la firme perspectiva de producir en gran cantidad las posturas de manzanos bajos con la tecnologia de punta de cultivo de tejido y producen auge laboral en la investigacion cientifica por superar las ciencias de punta.
					
					Choe convoco la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios concernientes tras recorrer el moderno invernadero de punta, que se contribuira al desarrollo de biotecnologia del pais, y varios lugares de la filial, donde se despliega con dinamismo la investigacion cientifica en acato a la resolucion del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, las consignas conjuntas del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el editorial conjunto publicado con motivo del Ano Nuevo.
					
					El foro discutio en detalles los temas que se presentan para desarrollar decisivamente la biotecnologia, tecnica basica medular para el desarrollo de las ciencias y las tecnicas de la epoca actual teniendo la gran afeccion y confianza del Dirigente.
					
					Tambien se tomaron medidas para que los dominios concernientes suministren con satisfaccion las materias primas y materiales necesarios a la investigacion cientifica.

articles.title: Embajador ruso se refiere al cumplimiento de acuerdo Corea-Rusia
articles.content:
Embajador ruso se refiere al cumplimiento de acuerdo Corea-Rusia 
Pyongyang, 4 de febrero (ACNC) -- El embajador de la Federacion Rusa en Corea, Valery Sukhinin, hablo en una rueda de prensa sobre el estado de relaciones entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la FR. 
					Despues de las cumbres bilaterales celebradas a principios de la decada de 2000, se han dinamizado notablemente las relaciones entre ambos paises, dijo el diplomatico y prosiguio: 
					
					El encuentro entre el Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Kim Jong Il, y el Presidente ruso Dmitri Medvedev, realizado en agosto de 2011 en Ulan-Ude, dio nueva vitalidad a las relaciones entre los dos paises. En aquel entonces, ambas naciones acordaron realizar unos planes interesantes y esos acuerdos siguen siendo vigentes y estan en cumplimiento. 
					
					La Direccion actual de la RPDC encabezada por el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un cumple todos los acuerdos alcanzados antes con Rusia, inclusive la construccion de gasoducto. 
					
					La Direccion coreana seguira cumpliendo en adelante tambien el acuerdo sobre el gasoducto a construir en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					La compania rusa Gazprom esta gestionando este tema junto con el Ministerio de Industria Petrolera de la RPDC.

articles.title: Afiches por Festival Nacional de Bellas Artes por 15 de abril
articles.content:
Afiches por Festival Nacional de Bellas Artes por 15 de abril
Pyongyang, 4 de febrero (ACNC) -- Se dieron a luz afiches para el Festival Nacional de Bellas Artes por el centenario de natalicio del Presidente            Kim Il Sung.
					En los afiches se ven las letras tales como "Festival Nacional de Bellas Artes por el centenario de natalicio del padre Lider" y el lugar y el plazo del festival.
					
					En un afiche esta dibujada la casa natal del Presidente en Mangyongdae con las hermosas flores de magnolia en el trasfondo, y en los otros esta grabada la charretera de mariscal y las letras "Festival Nacional de Bellas Artes 'Gran Sol de Corea de Songun'" y "IV Festival Nacional de Bosquejo por 16 de Febrero".
					
					Los afiches reflejan la aspiracion y el deseo del pueblo coreano de enaltecer al Presidente           Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y celebrar solemnemente el Dia del Sol y el Dia de la Estrella Luz.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun rechaza acusacion de politicos japoneses
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun rechaza acusacion de politicos japoneses
Pyongyang, 4 de febrero (ACNC) -- En estos dias, el premier y el ministro del Exterior de Japon dijeron unas palabras irracionales sobre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea como el supuesto "estado imprevisible" y el "cese de enriquecimiento de uranio".
					En un comentario individual difundido este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que esos dichos parten del intento de inducir al "cambio" a la RPDC, y continua:
					
					El mundo se admiro de la fidelidad, la obligacion moral, la fe en la victoria, la voluntad y espiritu indoblegables demostrados por el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea durante el gran duelo nacional.
					
					Japon sabra tambien que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, unidos con mas firmeza en torno a la Direccion de la Revolucion convirtiendo la tristeza en las fuerzas y el coraje, se levantaron como gigantes en la lucha por construir un Estado prospero.
					
					Las autoridades japonesas deberan sentirse avergonzadas en lugar de criticar a la RPDC con la pauta con que mide la sucia situacion politica de su casa.
					
					El "estado imprevisible" puede darse no en Corea sino en los paises como Japon.
					
					Que se preparen los politiqueros japoneses para esa contingencia en lugar de preocuparse de los asuntos ajenos.
